TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit NativeObjectSecurity extends System.Security.AccessControl.CommonObjectSecurity

Docs.summary: Provides the ability to control access to native objects without direct manipulation of Access Control Lists (ACLs). Native object types are defined by the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.ResourceType"> enumeration.

MemberSignature.Value: protected NativeObjectSecurity (bool isContainer, System.Security.AccessControl.ResourceType resourceType);
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool isContainer, valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.ResourceType resourceType) cil managed

Docs.param: `true` if the new <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity"> object is a container object.
The type of securable object with which the new <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity"> object is associated.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity"> class with the specified values.

MemberSignature.Value: protected NativeObjectSecurity (bool isContainer, System.Security.AccessControl.ResourceType resourceType, System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle handle, System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlSections includeSections);

.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool isContainer, valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.ResourceType resourceType, class System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle handle, valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlSections includeSections) cil managed

Docs.param: `true` if the new <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity"> object is a container object.
The type of securable object with which the new <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity"> object is associated.
The handle of the securable object with which the new <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity"> object is associated.

One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlSections"> enumeration values that specifies the sections of the security descriptor (access rules, audit rules, owner, primary group) of the securable object to include in this <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity> object.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity"> class with the specified values. We recommend that the values of the parameters passed to the constructor and persist methods be identical. For more information, see Remarks.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When persisting a <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity> object, if the value of the parameter passed to the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity.Persist%2A> method is not identical to the value of the parameter passed to the constructor used to create that <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity> object, sections of the persisted <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity> object can contain unpredictable values. For example, if a constructor is called with an value of <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlSections>, and later a <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity.Persist%2A> method is called on that object with an value of <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlSections>, the resulting persisted <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity> object will contain unpredictable values for its audit rules, group, and owner.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override sealed void Persist (System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle handle, System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlSections includeSections);

.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Persist(class System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle handle, valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlSections includeSections) cil managed

Docs.param: The handle of the securable object with which this <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity"> object is associated.

One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlSections"> enumeration values that specifies the sections of the security descriptor (access rules, audit rules, owner, primary group) of the securable object to save.
Docs.summary: Saves the specified sections of the security descriptor associated with this <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity"> object to permanent storage. We recommend.persist that the values of the parameters passed to the constructor and persist methods be identical. For more information, see Remarks.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When persisting a <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity> object, if the value of the parameter passed to the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity.Persist%2A> method is not identical to the value of the parameter passed to the constructor used to create that <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity> object, sections of the persisted <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity> object can contain unpredictable values. For example, if a constructor is called with an value of <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlSections>, and later a <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity.Persist%2A> method is called on that object with an value of <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlSections>, the resulting persisted <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity> object will contain unpredictable values for its audit rules, group, and owner.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void Persist (System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle handle, System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlSections includeSections, object exceptionContext);

.method familyhidebysig instance void Persist(class System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle handle, valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlSections includeSections, object exceptionContext) cil managed

Docs.param: The handle of the securable object with which this <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity"> object is associated.

One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlSections"> enumeration values that specifies the sections of the security descriptor (access rules, audit rules, owner, primary group) of the securable object to save.
An object that contains contextual information about the source or destination of the exception.
Docs.summary: Saves the specified sections of the security descriptor associated with this <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.NativeObjectSecurity"> object to permanent storage. We recommend that the values of the parameters passed to the constructor and persist methods be identical. For more information, see Remarks.
